name: Orchestral Symphony Metaphor

mappings.label: Choose Orchestra
mappings.description: The checkpoint is the foundational musical group — selecting which ensemble (classical, jazz, electronic, etc.) determines the tonal character of everything that follows. Strong fit because model selection is abstract and can be richly represented; weak because users need to see the actual model name, not just 'Orchestra Type A'.

facadeControls.label: Orchestra Style
facadeControls.rationale: Dropdown naturally maps to choosing between discrete checkpoint options. Each option can display the actual checkpoint filename for accuracy.

mappings.assetPrompt: Icon showing a conductor's baton, musical staff lines, and silhouettes of diverse instruments (violin, trumpet, cello, piano) arranged in a semicircle. Warm gold lighting, professional orchestral aesthetic, 256x256.

mappings.label: Positive Musical Movements
mappings.description: Text prompts are the composer's written instructions — what melodies, rhythms, and emotional arcs should be performed. This is CRITICAL: text input MUST remain explicitly textual. Users type descriptive phrases, and a 'score' metaphor preserves that. The positive prompt is 'what we want to hear'. Strong elementFit because composition requires textual direction; perfect inputOutputFit because text naturally flows into textual controls.

facadeControls.label: Compose Movements
facadeControls.rationale: Large text area where users write descriptive phrases (adagio, triumphant crescendo, jazzy rhythms). Keeps the text explicit and editable. 'Compose' suggests active authorship.

mappings.assetPrompt: An open musical score sheet with handwritten notes, clefs, and dynamics markings. A quill pen rests on the page. Soft parchment background, warm candlelight, 256x256.

mappings.label: Negative Musical Movements
mappings.description: The negative prompt is 'what we do NOT want to hear' — the discord, jarring notes, or unwanted tonalities to suppress. Identical mapping logic to positive prompt but semantically inverted. Text remains explicitly textual and editable. ElementFit is strong for the same compositional reasoning; truthfulness is high because it genuinely represents prohibition in music.

facadeControls.label: Suppress Dissonance
facadeControls.rationale: Text area for describing what NOT to include — harsh noise, out-of-key intervals, jarring transitions. 'Suppress' and 'Dissonance' frame this as filtering unwanted elements from the composition.

mappings.assetPrompt: A musical score sheet with red X marks and strikethrough notation over certain notes and passages. A red pen or pencil marks rejected sections. Slightly darker parchment, stern overhead lighting, 256x256.

mappings.label: Prepare Stage Dimensions
mappings.description: The empty latent is the blank canvas — an empty concert hall stage waiting to be filled with sound and performance. Width/height/batch_size map to stage dimensions and number of simultaneous performances. ElementFit is moderate (a stage is a 'blank space' but not directly about image generation); inputOutputFit is moderate because latent space is abstract, and mapping dimensions to 'stage size' is somewhat loose but functional.

facadeControls.label: Stage Width (pixels)
facadeControls.rationale: Numeric slider for actual pixel dimensions. 'Stage Width' makes the spatial constraint concrete without hiding the technical parameter.

facadeControls.label: Stage Height (pixels)
facadeControls.rationale: Numeric slider for height. Same rationale as width — preserves technical accuracy while using metaphor language.

facadeControls.label: Simultaneous Performances
facadeControls.rationale: Slider for batch_size. 'Simultaneous Performances' metaphor: you can generate multiple images in parallel, just as an orchestra can perform the same piece multiple times. Truthful because it directly maps to batch count.

mappings.assetPrompt: An empty concert hall stage viewed from audience perspective. Dramatic spotlights illuminate the bare wooden stage. Velvet curtains frame the sides. Grand piano visible in shadow. Clean, modern 3D rendering, 256x256.

mappings.label: Rehearse & Refine
mappings.description: The KSampler is the rehearsal process — the orchestra rehearses repeatedly (steps), with increasing precision and polish (cfg), using different interpretations (samplers) and different starting points (seed). ElementFit is STRONG because rehearsal is genuinely iterative refinement. InputOutputFit is strong because latent inputs and image outputs are both about 'performance quality improving'. This is the core generative step, and the metaphor captures it well.

facadeControls.label: Rehearsal Passes
facadeControls.rationale: Slider mapped to steps. 'Rehearsal Passes' is intuitive and truthful — more passes = more iterations of the diffusion process. Range 1-100 steps makes sense for rehearsal intensity.

facadeControls.label: Strict Score Adherence (CFG)
facadeControls.rationale: Slider for CFG. 'Strict Score Adherence' — higher CFG means 'follow the composer's instructions more closely'. Low CFG = creative freedom. Intuitive because rehearsals balance 'how closely to follow the score' vs. 'creative interpretation'.

facadeControls.label: Interpretation Seed
facadeControls.rationale: Slider for seed (often shown as random button or numeric). 'Interpretation Seed' — each seed is a different artistic interpretation starting point. Truthful because it directly controls randomization. Intuitive because 'different seeds = different interpretations'.

facadeControls.label: Rehearsal Technique
facadeControls.rationale: Dropdown for sampler_name. Different samplers = different rehearsal methodologies (Euler method = methodical, DPM++ = expressive, etc.). Abstracts the technical sampler choice into 'rehearsal philosophy'.

facadeControls.label: Rehearsal Schedule
facadeControls.rationale: Dropdown for scheduler. 'Rehearsal Schedule' — how to pace the iterations. Karras = structured, simple = flexible. Maps scheduler choice to rehearsal pacing philosophy.

facadeControls.label: Refine Detail (Denoise)
facadeControls.rationale: Slider for denoise (0-1). 'Refine Detail' — higher denoise = more polishing of details. In rehearsal, you gradually refine technique. Truthful mapping of actual parameter.

mappings.assetPrompt: An orchestra mid-rehearsal. Musicians in various poses — some playing intensely, some reading scores, conductor with baton raised in mid-gesture. Sheet music stands scattered, professional studio lighting. Dynamic, energetic composition, 256x256.

mappings.label: Master Recording
mappings.description: The VAE decode converts latent representation to final image, analogous to mastering a rehearsal recording into a high-quality audio file. ElementFit is moderate (mastering is 'technical refinement' but not directly image-related); inputOutputFit is moderate because latent → image is abstract but 'mastering recording' captures the idea of format conversion and quality enhancement. Intermediate step that doesn't require much user interaction, so relatively light on controls.
mappings.assetPrompt: A professional audio mastering console with faders, knobs, and VU meters. A sound engineer sits at the mixing desk. High-quality studio environment with acoustic panels. Digital waveform display on monitors. Precise, professional aesthetic, 256x256.

mappings.label: Release Recording
mappings.description: The final save is the release — publishing the recorded, mastered performance as a permanent artifact. ElementFit is strong (releasing a recording is genuinely about saving/publishing); inputOutputFit is strong (the image is the final deliverable, like a published record). This is where the performance becomes a tangible product.

facadeControls.label: Recording Title
facadeControls.rationale: Text field for filename_prefix. 'Recording Title' — users name their output. Intuitive because albums have titles; truthful because it directly controls the saved filename.

mappings.assetPrompt: A vinyl record album cover laid flat, showing intricate artwork. The record itself is visible behind it, shiny black vinyl. Album case opened, with liner notes visible. Professional photography, warm studio lighting, 256x256.

threadStyle.metaphor: Musical signals and data flowing between ensemble, composition, stage, rehearsal, mastering, and release

waveMetaphor: Data tokens appear as musical notes flowing along the threads — thick brown notes (model/ensemble) from checkpoint; blue notes (text/composition) from score cards; golden shimmering waves (latent energy) feeding into rehearsal; red crystalline notes (final image) flowing to release. Notes brighten and sharpen as they move through refinement steps.
sceneDescription: A bird's-eye view of a professional music production studio arranged horizontally. On the left, the Orchestra Ensemble Selection (conductor's podium). Center-left, two Score sheets (positive and negative). Center, the Empty Concert Hall Stage. Center-right, the Rehearsal Area with musicians actively performing. Right-center, the Mastering Console. Far right, a Vinyl Release Station. Threads connect all elements as flowing musical signals. Warm ambient lighting with spotlights on key areas.
aiVocabulary: In this metaphor, the user is a composer and conductor orchestrating an AI-assisted musical performance. The workflow is described as: 'Select your ensemble (model), compose the positive and negative movements (text prompts), prepare the stage (dimensions), conduct rehearsals with various techniques and intensities (sampling), master the recording (VAE), and release the vinyl (save). Each rehearsal pass refines the performance, guided by how strictly you require adherence to the score (CFG). Different interpretation seeds and rehearsal techniques yield different artistic results from the same composition.'

attributeScores.rationale: Dropdown explicitly shows model name while using 'Orchestra' framing. High truthfulness because dropdown directly reflects checkpoint options. Intuitive because selecting an ensemble type is familiar.

mappingScores.rationale: Model selection is abstract and orchestral framing works well. Weakness: users may want technical details (model size, architecture) hidden by the metaphor, though the dropdown can still display real names.

attributeScores.rationale: Text input MUST remain textual. This mapping preserves that perfectly. 'Compose Movements' frames text authorship naturally. Users type descriptive phrases directly. High truthfulness because it's literal text editing. Intuitive because composition requires written instructions.

mappingScores.rationale: Excellent mapping. Textual input is preserved explicitly. The composer/score metaphor elegantly frames how text prompts guide generation. No loss of capability or clarity.

attributeScores.rationale: Identical to positive prompt in terms of technical handling, but semantically inverted. 'Suppress Dissonance' is intuitive because negative prompts literally suppress unwanted elements. High truthfulness; high intuitiveness.

mappingScores.rationale: Excellent. Same strengths as positive prompt. The inversion (dissonance vs. movements) is semantically clear and intuitive.

attributeScores.rationale: Slider shows actual pixel width. 'Stage Width' is somewhat loose metaphorically (latent isn't a 'stage') but truthful. Intuitive because users understand width as a spatial dimension.
Same as width. Truthful pixel mapping; moderate intuitiveness due to abstract latent → stage correlation.
'Simultaneous Performances' is intuitive — multiple batches = multiple parallel outputs. Truthful because slider directly maps batch_size. Good explanatory power.

mappingScores.rationale: Moderate mapping. The 'empty stage' metaphor for latent space is loose but functional. Dimension controls are truthful and reasonably intuitive. Weakness: latent space is fundamentally abstract; calling it a 'stage' doesn't deeply explain what's happening.

attributeScores.rationale: Excellent fit. 'Rehearsal Passes' directly maps iteration count. More passes = more refinement. Intuitive because rehearsals involve repeated practice. Truthful range (1-100).

'Strict Score Adherence' captures CFG well — higher values = closer to prompt. Intuitive because rehearsals balance 'following instructions' vs. 'creative freedom'. Truthfulness: metaphor slightly simplifies (CFG is classifier-free guidance), but direction is accurate.

'Interpretation Seed' — each seed yields different artistic choices. Truthful because seed directly controls randomization. Intuitive in context: different seeds = different ways to play the same score.
Dropdown abstracts sampler selection as 'rehearsal methodology'. Moderate truthfulness because sampler names (Euler, DPM++) have no inherent rehearsal analogy. Intuitive framing but somewhat loose.
'Rehearsal Schedule' maps scheduler choice to pacing philosophy. Similar issue to sampler_name — the metaphor is intuitive but not deeply truthful to what schedulers actually do.
'Refine Detail' captures denoise parameter well. Higher denoise = more polishing. Intuitive because 'refining details' is familiar. Truthful because parameter directly controls denoising intensity.

mappingScores.rationale: Strong mapping. Rehearsal metaphor is genuinely iterative and captures the core generation process. Steps, CFG, and seed controls are excellent (9/10). Sampler and scheduler controls are good but slightly abstract (6-7/10). Overall very effective at making diffusion sampling intuitive.

Moderate fit. VAE decode is a format conversion (latent → image) which mastering loosely parallels (mixing → mastered audio). Weakness: mastering isn't image-related, and the metaphor doesn't explicitly show users what's happening. Low user interaction on this node, so facade controls minimal. The metaphor works but is somewhat disconnected from the actual output (images, not audio).

attributeScores.rationale: 'Recording Title' frames filename as naming an album, which is intuitive. Truthful because text field directly sets filename prefix. Users understand that saving requires a title/name.

mappingScores.rationale: Strong mapping. Publishing/releasing is the natural endpoint for a creative process. Vinyl metaphor is concrete and memorable. The visual of a record cover works well. Filename parameter maps naturally to 'title'. Good closure to the workflow.

ioAnalysis.rationale: Text input handling is EXCELLENT — both positive and negative prompts remain explicitly textual. Users type words and see them as 'compositional directions'. Model input is excellent — selecting an ensemble is a rich, intuitive abstraction. Intermediate handling (latent, VAE) is moderate — the metaphor doesn't deeply explain what latent space is, and mastering is loosely connected. Final output handling is good but imperfect — users get images, not audio recordings. The vinyl record metaphor works as a 'container' for the output, but the actual artifact (image) doesn't perfectly match the metaphor (music/record). This is acceptable because metaphors need not be 100% literal.

scores.rationale: The Orchestral Symphony metaphor is strong and coherent. Explanatory Power (8/10): Text prompts as composition, sampling as rehearsal, and output as a recorded release are all clear and intuitive. The orchestra framing explains how diverse inputs combine into a unified output. Truthfulness (8/10): Facade controls mostly map directly to parameters (steps→passes, CFG→adherence, denoise→refinement). Weaknesses: sampler_name and scheduler are somewhat loose abstractions (6/10 each); VAE decode as 'mastering' is moderately abstract. Completeness (9/10): All major knots are mapped. Positive/negative text prompts both included. All critical KSampler parameters have controls (steps, CFG, seed, sampler, scheduler, denoise). Minor: VAE and Save have no extensive controls, but that's appropriate (VAE is pass-through; Save is simple). Intuitive Interaction (8/10): Rehearsal metaphor is genuinely intuitive for diffusion sampling. Text-based composition maps well to text prompts. Stage dimensions are clear. Weaknesses: latent space (6/10) and mastering (6/10) are abstract. Fractal Consistency (8/10): The metaphor is mostly uniform — musical/orchestral elements throughout. Slight inconsistency: audio mastering in a visual workflow, and final output is images not sound. But the 'recording → vinyl release' frame bridges this acceptably. Overall: 8.1/10 weighted average (0.30×8 + 0.25×8 + 0.20×9 + 0.15×8 + 0.10×8 = 8.1). This is a coherent, user-friendly metaphor that preserves critical information (text input) while adding intuitive framing. Key strengths: excellent text prompt handling (9/10), excellent sampling explanation (8-9/10), strong output framing (8/10). Key weaknesses: latent space abstraction (6/10), sampler/scheduler looseness (6/10), audio-image mismatch (minor).
